How to Install tendermint on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • tendermint

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install tendermint on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing tendermint on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall tendermint in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install tendermint, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install tendermint Using apt

To install tendermint in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install tendermint using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install tendermint

The installation of tendermint might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install tendermint Using apt-get

To install tendermint using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install tendermint.

sudo apt-get -y install tendermint

Install tendermint Using Synaptic

To install tendermint using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install tendermint on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for tendermint. This will display the tendermint package in the package window, now to install tendermint, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the tendermint package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of tendermint.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install tendermint Using aptitude

To install tendermint on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of tendermint.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install tendermint using the command aptitude install tendermint.

sudo aptitude -y install tendermint

How to Upgrade tendermint on debian

If you want to upgrade the tendermint package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade tendermint using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade tendermint to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade tendermint.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade tendermint sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade tendermint

Upgrade tendermint using Aptitude

To upgrade tendermint using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade tendermint.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade tendermint

Upgrade tendermint using Synaptic

To upgrade tendermint using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for tendermint, now right-click tendermint, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade tendermint just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall tendermint on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall tendermint from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just tendermint, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove tendermint

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of tendermint

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of tendermint you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge tendermint

Remove tendermint using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall tendermint using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for tendermint, right-click the tendermint package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall tendermint click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install tendermint on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade tendermint using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
